summary: This video explores the growing influence and controversy surrounding the Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc (UTMB) event, particularly focusing on criticisms made by prominent ultra runners Kilian Jornet and Zach Miller, and the emergence of alternative movements.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man sitting on a beige couch in a room adorned with a wall clock and a shelf filled with medals and a red box labeled 'SWIFT.' He is dressed in a dark sweater with buttons and appears to be speaking. The scene transitions to a festive background featuring two individuals, one in a blue jacket holding a blue cup and the other in a gray t-shirt with the text 'WALLS ARE MEANT FOR CLIMBING,' surrounded by colorful lights and the word 'Happy' in cursive. The video then returns to the man on the couch, continuing his speech. A screenshot of a running app follows, displaying a user named Jim Walmsley with a running route in Beaufort, France, dated 27 October 2023, showing a distance of 15.44 km, an elevation gain of 1,194 m, and a time of 2 hours and 16 minutes. The video concludes with the man on the couch, still speaking, maintaining the same background and attire throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with upbeat, energetic music, creating a positive mood. A single male speaker then poses a question about Kilian Jornet and Zach Miller potentially impacting UTMB. Transitioning from the musical intro, the speaker describes an email sent to top ultra runners, stating it was a "call to action". He mentions Jim Walmsley's Strava activity and references Killian and Zach taking things "one step further." The speaker summarizes the email as a plea for elites to abandon UTMB and participate in an alternative race, followed by a fade out.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black sweater with a high collar and three buttons, standing in a room adorned with medals on the wall behind him. The room also contains a clock and a shelf with various items, including an orange box labeled 'Zwift.' The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. The scene transitions to an animated blue fish with yellow fins and a black stripe, set against a blue underwater background. The fish has a surprised expression, and text appears above and below it, reading 'I'M NEVER RUNNING AGAIN' and 'OH LOOK! A RACE!' respectively. The video then returns to the man in the black sweater, who continues to speak in the same room with the medals, clock, and 'Zwift' box in the background. The man's expressions and mouth movements suggest he is engaged in a conversation or delivering a message. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere, with the man as the central figure throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker, sounding curious and inquisitive, asking "And some of you may be asking, why?". His tone then shifts to explanatory as he delves into background information about UTMB. Another male voice briefly interjects, speaking in a surprised tone as he says "Oh, have you not heard?", indicating awareness of the topic. The first male speaker continues to provide context, elaborating on the origin of UTMB's point system, the impact on local events, and concerns about market dominance. The audio is clear with background sounds unobtrusive enough to provide a distraction.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark sweater with a high collar and three buttons, standing in a room adorned with medals on the wall and a clock. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change. The background includes a white couch and a shelf with various items, including an orange box labeled "SWIFT." The man gestures with his hands, pointing upwards and making other movements to emphasize his speech. The lighting is warm, creating a cozy atmosphere. The video includes a close-up of a screen displaying a list of races and points, with text in English, such as "Entry conditions: 10 Points with 2 races or at least 1 Stone & a valid Index," and "Current points: 8 Points." The man continues to speak and gesture, maintaining a consistent setting throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio starts with a male speaker discussing the UTMB World Series and its strategy of acquiring existing races or creating new ones, mentioning Gary Robbins' Whistler controversy. He suggests listeners click a link to learn more about "the whole horrendous muddy cesspit". There is a brief, light, comedic sound effect, followed by the speaker continuing about UTMB being accused of railroading Gary Robbins' event. He mentions the details are unclear, with some not blaming UTMB. He concludes it's an unsavory incident that's not gone down well in the trail and ultra running community.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a screenshot of a Facebook group page titled 'Trail And Ultra Running,' featuring a post questioning whether the group is boycotting UTMB races. The scene transitions to a man in a dark sweater, standing in a room adorned with medals and a clock, speaking directly to the camera. The video then shifts to a webpage displaying an open letter to the trail running community, discussing the importance of event organizers in the sport's growth. Returning to the man in the dark sweater, the video continues with him speaking, maintaining the same background. The scene changes to a graphic with the text 'THE IRONMAN GROUP' and 'THEIR SIDE OF THE WHISTLER STORY,' featuring a person in a blue jacket. The video concludes with the man in the dark sweater continuing his speech, with the consistent background of medals, a clock, and an orange 'Zwift' sign.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker discussing a "backlash against UTMB" and mentioning calls for a boycott. He states that UTMB issued an open letter and spoke to media outlets to explain their side. He concludes this incident is just one of many, his tone is informative and neutral. Then, the audio cuts off abruptly.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man standing in a room adorned with medals and a clock, wearing a dark sweater with buttons. The scene transitions to an outdoor event where two individuals in matching blue floral shirts are seen at a finish line, with a digital clock displaying '15:04:02' above them. The man on the right holds a microphone, capturing the moment. The next frame shows an Instagram post by 'corrinemalcolm' announcing the departure of the man from the UTMB team, expressing his disappointment and commitment to his values. The video then shifts to a news article headline 'UTMB fires livestream commentator Corrine Malcolm,' followed by a podcast episode titled 'Ep 524 | UTMB Commentator Fired For Being Too Outspoken,' discussing the incident. The video returns to the man in the room, continuing his narrative, and concludes with a close-up of the same man, emphasizing his expressions and the room's details, including the 'Zwift' sign and medals.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker discussing the firing of Corinne Malcolm from UTMB Live for being "too outspoken" about UTMB's "aggressive monopolization policy," using a somewhat conversational and informative tone. This event "upset a lot of people," he concludes.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man standing in a room adorned with medals and a clock, wearing a dark sweater with a high collar and buttons. The scene transitions to a webpage for 'The Green Runners,' featuring a collage of images and a welcoming message, inviting viewers to join the community. The video then returns to the man in the room, who appears to be speaking. The narrative shifts to an outdoor setting with an orange Dacia car parked on a dirt road, accompanied by the text 'UTMB World Series' and 'Official Automotive Partner,' indicating a sponsorship. The video continues with a large group of people gathered under a banner that reads 'UTMB World Series' and 'Dacia UTMB Mont Blanc,' with a digital clock displaying '11:50:34,' suggesting a race event. The atmosphere is lively, with spectators and participants visible, emphasizing the event's scale and excitement.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single male speaker talking in an informative tone. He mentions the "green runners", led by an environmentalist and "one-time fifth-place finisher at UTMB". He then discusses calls for UTMB to "ditch their headline sponsor Dacia", a company known for making money from "particularly non-environmentally friendly products."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man standing in a room adorned with medals and a clock on the wall, wearing a dark sweater with buttons. The scene transitions to a webpage from Runner's World, announcing Kilian Jornet's withdrawal from the UTMB due to a sacrum injury. The article, written by Alice Babbagolouh and published on August 21, 2023, explains that Jornet, a four-time winner of the world's biggest ultramarathon, is unable to run due to the injury. The video then shifts to a webpage from Trail Runner, also reporting Jornet's withdrawal, with an update by Abby Levane on August 21, 2023. The scene returns to the man in the room, followed by a shot of a large crowd gathered at the UTMB finish line, with banners displaying 'UTMB World Series' and 'Dacia UTMB Mont Blanc.' The video concludes with the man in the room, continuing to speak, with the background featuring a shelf with red bottles and a clock.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a conversational discussion. A male speaker shares an observation, stating that "Kilian had been registered to run UTMB in 2023" but withdrew after UTMB announced a headline sponsor, "citing injury as the reason." He suggests, "Your guess is as good as mine." He further explains that the sponsor had been a sponsor of UTMB previously, referencing his 2022 race video where UTMB was on a banner and Kilian won. The overall tone is narrative, somewhat inquisitive, but not accusatory.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black sweater with a high collar and three buttons, standing in a room adorned with a wall clock and a shelf filled with medals and trophies. The background includes a beige couch and a wall-mounted orange box labeled 'SWIFT.' The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his mouth movements and facial expressions. The video transitions to a graphic displaying the 'WORLD TRAIL MAJORS 2024 SCHEDULE,' listing various trail running events with their dates, distances, elevation gains, and locations. The schedule includes events such as the HK100 in Hong Kong, the Black Canyon 100 in Arizona, and the Transvulcania in Gran Canaria, among others. The video then returns to the man in the room, who continues to speak, with a 'like' icon appearing on the screen, suggesting a call to action for viewers to engage with the content. The overall atmosphere is informative and motivational, focusing on the upcoming trail running events and the achievements of the individual featured.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker enthusiastically introducing a new "World Trail Majors Series", describing it as "a direct response" to recent trends in trail and ultra running. The speaker implies the series is "an attempt to redress the balance," possibly referencing UTMB. Before moving on, the speaker asks the audience to "consider subscribing to the channel" if they're enjoying the content. The speaker then prepares to "highlight a few details" for the listener. There are background sounds of keyboard typing during the narration.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a text message displayed on a screen, discussing a proposal to race each other at a race other than UTMB in 2024. The message acknowledges the strong ties many have to UTMB due to personal goals, sponsor incentives, and career aspirations, while inviting the recipient to consider the proposal. The scene transitions to a man with gray hair, wearing a dark sweater, sitting in a room adorned with medals and a clock on the wall, suggesting a setting related to sports achievements. The video then returns to a close-up of text on a screen, expressing gratitude for UTMB's contributions to the sport of ultra running, highlighting its role in attracting top runners, sponsors, media, and fans, and its impact on elevating the sport's profile globally. The text emphasizes the positive influence of UTMB on the sport, despite recent drama, and acknowledges the opportunities it has created for athletes. The video maintains a focus on the text, with no additional visual elements or changes in the environment, providing a clear and direct message about the significance of UTMB in the context of ultra running.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker initiating a discussion, stating, "We are writing to see if you might be interested," followed by a summary suggesting a proposal to race each other outside of a major event. He acknowledges the importance of the main event in putting the sport "on the map."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with gray hair, wearing a dark sweater with a high collar and large buttons, seated in a room with a beige couch behind him. The wall behind him is adorned with a collection of medals and a clock, while an orange banner with the word "SWIFT" hangs on the wall. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. The scene transitions to a series of text slides, each containing a paragraph of text in English. The text discusses concerns about the management of events by the UTMB Group and Ironman, emphasizing the importance of positive growth in the sport and the need for organizations to consider the best interests of the sport and its participants. The text highlights the desire for organizations to not only benefit themselves but also to improve the sport of trail running as a whole. The video then returns to the man, who continues to speak, maintaining the same background and setting throughout. The atmosphere of the video is serious and focused, with the man's expressions and the text slides conveying a message about the importance of ethical and considerate management in sports events.
events_list.audio_caption: A female voice begins speaking in a declarative tone, presenting a statement about a feeling of mismanagement, and advocating for athletes to use their influence. Light, motivational music plays faintly in the background, adding a positive backdrop to the spoken words.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with gray hair, wearing a dark buttoned shirt, seated in a room adorned with a wall clock, a shelf with red items, and a display of medals. He appears to be speaking, as indicated by his mouth movements and the presence of a microphone clipped to his shirt. The scene transitions to a text overlay discussing concerns about the UTMB race, suggesting that top-ranked runners should boycott it to apply pressure for change. The text is highlighted in blue, emphasizing key points. The video then shows a schedule of the World Trail Majors 2024, listing various races with their dates, distances, elevation gains, and locations. The man continues to speak, and the video returns to the text overlay, which further elaborates on the desire for positive change in the sport, stressing that the intention is not malicious but to effect improvement. The text is again highlighted in blue. The video concludes with the man still speaking, maintaining the same background setting throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker talking in a conversational tone about the "absence of the top 15 ranked male and female athletes" and how they "already have an alternative race in mind". He speculates about what "Killian and Zach" have in mind, mentioning possible world trail majors like "the Quebec trail or the South Africa Cape Town Ultra trail". He continues with a summary of an email, stating, "The idea here is to find a way to apply some pressure to the UTMB Ironman organization so that we can effect positive change... and feel good about it." The clip concludes with the sound of a spray can.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in a room adorned with medals and a clock on the wall, wearing a dark sweater with buttons. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change. The background includes a beige couch and a shelf with various items, including an orange box labeled "SWIFT." The scene transitions to a close-up of the man, with a series of social media comments displayed on the right side of the screen. The comments are from different users, expressing excitement and engagement with the content. The man continues to speak, and the video then shows a wider shot of him in the same room, with the medals and clock still visible in the background. Logos of various brands, including Adidas, Hoka, Inov-8, and Salomon, appear on the screen, suggesting a sponsorship or partnership. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout, focusing on the man's speech and the visual elements in the room.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker questioning the implications of recent events for UTMB, wondering if elite athletes will race elsewhere. He then opines that this is unlikely, mentioning some elites aiming for a UTMB win and the influence of sponsors on athletes' choices, as they are paid to be full-time ultra runners. Throughout the speech, a thoughtful and analytical tone is present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in a room adorned with various sports-related items, including a collection of medals hanging on the wall behind him and a clock. He is dressed in a dark-colored sweater with a high collar and buttons. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. The background includes a beige couch and a shelf with several red and black bottles, as well as an orange banner with the word "Zwift" on it. The lighting in the room is warm, creating a cozy atmosphere. The video transitions to a close-up of a social media post from "vo2maxcoaching" based in Chamonix, France. The post discusses the challenges and pride associated with the UTMB race, highlighting the financial support and opportunities it provides to athletes. The text is displayed in white against a black background, with certain phrases highlighted in orange to emphasize key points. The video maintains a consistent focus on the man and the social media post, providing a narrative that connects the personal experiences of the man with the broader context of the UTMB race and its impact on athletes.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the influence of sponsors on athletes' race choices, suggesting that a mass exodus from UTMB is unlikely. He notes that many supporters view the situation as posturing and unwarranted hate towards UTMB and the Ironman Group. The speaker mentions being undecided about the situation. There is no background music or any other sounds in this audio clip.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man with gray hair and a black buttoned shirt is seen speaking directly to the camera in a room adorned with a collection of medals hanging on the wall behind him. The room also features a large clock and a shelf with various items, including a red box labeled "SWIFT." The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as indicated by his facial expressions and gestures. The setting suggests a personal or professional space, possibly related to sports or achievements, given the presence of the medals. The lighting is warm, creating a cozy atmosphere. Throughout the video, the man maintains eye contact with the camera, emphasizing his engagement with the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker expressing having "no problem with big business" and its growth. He then discusses UTMB, not believing it a threat to local running, asserting independent companies and grassroots races will always exist. Though he will be present at start lines for both, he feels UTMB often disregards the trail-running community and other businesses in the space. Overall his tone is thoughtful and critical.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a black sweater with a buttoned collar is seen speaking directly to the camera. He is situated in a room with a beige couch behind him, and the wall is adorned with a collection of medals and a clock. To the right, there is a shelf with red and black bottles, and an orange banner with the word "SWIFT" written on it. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as he uses hand gestures to emphasize his points. The lighting in the room is warm, creating a cozy atmosphere. Throughout the video, the man's facial expressions and gestures change as he speaks, indicating a dynamic and engaging discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker critiquing UTMB, urging them to be more transparent and considerate, otherwise discontent may grow. She then comments that all things end and promotes a link to another video on the Gary Robbins Whistler controversy. She concludes by thanking viewers, inviting them to subscribe, and promising to see them on the start line. In the background, uplifting and encouraging music plays.
